definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: Most boxers can fight only five rounds because this kind of fighting is very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 大多数拳击手只能打五轮，因为这种拼斗非常困难。

sentences.english: Make fox blunt finally untied the rope and yue not the cluster battle.
sentences.chinese: 令狐冲终于解开了绳子和岳不群拼斗起来。

sentences.english: They were prepared to fight the fiercest panther or a pack of lobo .
sentences.chinese: 他们准备和最凶猛的黑豹或一群大灰狼拼斗。

definition: to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
to fight or argue on a blogging site (netspeak)
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
combined assault/to mount a joint attack
